Apple___Apple_scab.description: A fungal disease caused by Venturia inaequalis resulting in dark lesions on leaves and fruit.
Apple___Apple_scab.treatment: Apply fungicides containing captan or myclobutanil.
Apple___Apple_scab.prevention: Ensure proper pruning, remove fallen leaves, use disease-resistant cultivars.

Apple___Black_rot.description: A fungal disease causing cankers on branches and fruit rot, common in humid conditions.
Apple___Black_rot.treatment: Use fungicides like thiophanate-methyl; remove infected branches.
Apple___Black_rot.prevention: Avoid overhead watering; sanitize tools and remove plant debris.

Apple___Cedar_apple_rust.description: Caused by the fungus Gymnosporangium juniperi-virginianae; requires both apple and cedar hosts.
Apple___Cedar_apple_rust.treatment: Apply fungicides like mancozeb or myclobutanil early in the season.
Apple___Cedar_apple_rust.prevention: Remove nearby cedar trees if possible; use resistant apple varieties.

Apple___healthy.description: The apple leaf appears healthy with no visible signs of disease.
Apple___healthy.prevention: Maintain regular watering, pruning, and pest control.

Blueberry___healthy.description: Blueberry plant shows no visible disease symptoms.
Blueberry___healthy.prevention: Ensure proper soil pH, regular watering, and pest monitoring.

Cherry_(including_sour)___Powdery_mildew.description: Fungal disease causing white powdery growth on leaves and stems.
Cherry_(including_sour)___Powdery_mildew.treatment: Apply sulfur-based or potassium bicarbonate fungicides.
Cherry_(including_sour)___Powdery_mildew.prevention: Ensure good air circulation and avoid overhead watering.

Cherry_(including_sour)___healthy.description: Healthy cherry plant with no visible disease.
Cherry_(including_sour)___healthy.prevention: Monitor for early signs of mildew and prune regularly.

Corn_(maize)___Cercospora_leaf_spot Gray.description: Fungal disease causing rectangular lesions on leaves.
Corn_(maize)___Cercospora_leaf_spot Gray.treatment: Use fungicides like strobilurins or triazoles.
Corn_(maize)___Cercospora_leaf_spot Gray.prevention: Practice crop rotation; use resistant hybrids.

Corn_(maize)___Common_rust_.description: Fungal disease causing brown pustules on leaves.
Corn_(maize)___Common_rust_.treatment: Apply fungicides during early infection stages.
Corn_(maize)___Common_rust_.prevention: Plant resistant varieties; avoid excessive nitrogen.

Corn_(maize)___Northern_Leaf_Blight.description: Fungal disease producing long, gray-green lesions on leaves.

Corn_(maize)___healthy.description: No signs of leaf blight or rust; healthy plant.
Corn_(maize)___healthy.prevention: Maintain nutrient balance and monitor field regularly.

Grape___Black_rot.description: Fungal disease causing black spots on leaves and fruit.
Grape___Black_rot.treatment: Use fungicides like captan and myclobutanil.
Grape___Black_rot.prevention: Remove mummified fruits; ensure proper vine spacing.

Grape___Esca_(Black_Measles).description: A complex fungal disease leading to leaf scorching and berry spots.
Grape___Esca_(Black_Measles).treatment: Remove infected vines; apply systemic fungicides if needed.
Grape___Esca_(Black_Measles).prevention: Avoid vine injuries and ensure proper drainage.

Grape___Leaf_blight_(Isariopsis_Leaf_Spo.description: Caused by Isariopsis fungus; leads to necrotic spots and leaf fall.
Grape___Leaf_blight_(Isariopsis_Leaf_Spo.prevention: Increase airflow and reduce humidity around plants.

Grape___healthy.description: No signs of disease; healthy grapevine.

Orange___Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening).description: Bacterial disease spread by psyllids; causes yellow shoots and misshapen fruit.
Orange___Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening).treatment: No cure; remove infected trees and control psyllids.
Orange___Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening).prevention: Use certified disease-free seedlings; monitor for psyllid activity.

Peach___Bacterial_spot.description: Caused by Xanthomonas; leads to small, water-soaked spots on leaves and fruits.
Peach___Bacterial_spot.treatment: Use copper-based bactericides; prune affected areas.
Peach___Bacterial_spot.prevention: Avoid overhead irrigation and select resistant cultivars.

Peach___healthy.description: No visible bacterial or fungal infection.
Peach___healthy.prevention: Regular inspection and good cultural practices.

Pepper,_bell___Bacterial_spot.description: Causes dark, water-soaked lesions on leaves and fruits.
Pepper,_bell___Bacterial_spot.treatment: Apply fixed copper sprays early in the season.
Pepper,_bell___Bacterial_spot.prevention: Use disease-free seeds and rotate crops.

Pepper,_bell___healthy.description: Healthy pepper plant with no disease symptoms.
Pepper,_bell___healthy.prevention: Ensure good soil drainage and regular weeding.

Potato___Early_blight.description: Fungal disease causing concentric ring lesions on leaves.
Potato___Early_blight.prevention: Remove crop debris and rotate potatoes yearly.

Potato___Late_blight.description: Serious disease causing leaf and tuber rot, responsible for famines historically.
Potato___Late_blight.treatment: Use metalaxyl-based fungicides; remove infected plants.
Potato___Late_blight.prevention: Avoid wet foliage and plant-resistant varieties.

Potato___healthy.prevention: Maintain field hygiene and monitor weather conditions.

Raspberry___healthy.description: No signs of fungal or bacterial infection on raspberry leaves.

Soybean___healthy.description: Soybean crop showing no visual disease symptoms.
Soybean___healthy.prevention: Follow IPM strategies and rotate crops.

Squash___Powdery_mildew.description: White, powdery fungal growth on leaf surfaces.
Squash___Powdery_mildew.treatment: Apply neem oil or sulfur sprays.
Squash___Powdery_mildew.prevention: Water at soil level and allow for airflow.

Strawberry___Leaf_scorch.description: Fungal disease causing red-purple blotches on leaves.
Strawberry___Leaf_scorch.treatment: Remove infected leaves and use fungicides as needed.
Strawberry___Leaf_scorch.prevention: Avoid crowding and remove old mulch.

Strawberry___healthy.description: No visible signs of leaf scorch or fungal damage.
Strawberry___healthy.prevention: Ensure proper drainage and mulch usage.

Tomato___Bacterial_spot.description: Bacterial infection causing dark, greasy spots on leaves and fruits.
Tomato___Bacterial_spot.prevention: Use certified seeds and avoid working with wet plants.

Tomato___Early_blight.description: Dark concentric spots on older leaves; caused by Alternaria.
Tomato___Early_blight.prevention: Prune lower leaves and rotate crops annually.

Tomato___Late_blight.description: A water mold that causes wilting and gray mold on leaves and stems.
Tomato___Late_blight.prevention: Plant resistant varieties and water in the morning.

Tomato___Leaf_Mold.description: Causes yellow spots and grayish mold underneath leaves.
Tomato___Leaf_Mold.treatment: Improve ventilation and apply sulfur fungicides.
Tomato___Leaf_Mold.prevention: Use drip irrigation and reduce humidity.

Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot.description: Small, circular spots with dark borders on leaves.
Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot.prevention: Avoid overhead watering and ensure crop rotation.

Tomato___Spider_mites Two-spotted_spider.description: Tiny mites that cause stippling and webbing on leaves.
Tomato___Spider_mites Two-spotted_spider.treatment: Spray with miticides or neem oil.
Tomato___Spider_mites Two-spotted_spider.prevention: Increase humidity and wash plants regularly.

Tomato___Target_Spot.description: Causes target-like concentric spots on leaves and fruits.
Tomato___Target_Spot.treatment: Use fungicides like mancozeb or copper oxychloride.
Tomato___Target_Spot.prevention: Avoid water splash and ensure good airflow.

Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus.description: Viral infection spread by whiteflies causing leaf curl and yellowing.
Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus.treatment: Remove infected plants; control whitefly population.
Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus.prevention: Use yellow sticky traps and virus-free seedlings.

Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus.description: Viral disease that causes mottled and distorted leaves.
Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus.prevention: Avoid tobacco use around plants; practice crop rotation.

Tomato___healthy.description: No disease or pest damage visible on the plant.
